oliver

winter
ale
is
a

example
of
scottish
ale
the
web
says
this
beer
is
6
0
abv
however
my
bottle
says
6
1
abv
the
nominal
strength
is
half
a
percent
lower
than
guidelines
for
a
wee
heavy
but
1
abv
more
than
an
80
scottish
export
all
things
said
winter
ale
taste
like
a
wee
heavy
most
importantly
it
avoids
the
two
most
common
failings
of
american
craftbrewed
beer
first
its
not
too
hoppy
most
american
craftbrewers
especially
those
on
the
west
coast
use
far
too
many
hops
even
in
beer
styles
in
which
it
would
be
inappropriate
second
oliver
doesnt
use
whisky
malt
in
this
beer
